title: _Begriffsschrift_ Chapter II with equivalence of sets

blocks.name: axfrege52c
blocks.content: Justification for ~ ax-frege52c . (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: ax-frege52c
blocks.content: One side of ~ dfsbcq . Part of Axiom 52 of [Frege1879] p. 50. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege52b
blocks.content: The case when the content of ` x ` is identical with the content of ` y ` and in which a proposition controlled by an element for which we substitute the content of ` x ` is affirmed and the same proposition, this time where we substitute the content of ` y ` , is denied does not take place. In ` [ x / z ] ph ` , ` x ` can also occur in other than the argument ( ` z ` ) places. Hence ` x ` may still be contained in ` [ y / z ] ph ` . Part of Axiom 52 of [Frege1879] p. 50. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege53b
blocks.content: Lemma for frege102 (via ~ frege92 ). Proposition 53 of [Frege1879] p. 50. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axfrege54c
blocks.content: Reflexive equality of classes. Identical to ~ eqid . Justification for ~ ax-frege54c . (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: ax-frege54c
blocks.content: Reflexive equality of sets (as classes). Part of Axiom 54 of [Frege1879] p. 50. Identical to ~ eqid . (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege54b
blocks.content: Reflexive equality of sets. The content of ` x ` is identical with the content of ` x ` . Part of Axiom 54 of [Frege1879] p. 50. Slightly specialized version of ~ eqid . (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege54cor1b
blocks.content: Reflexive equality. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: frege55lem1b
blocks.content: Necessary deduction regarding substitution of value in equality. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: frege55lem2b
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ frege55b . Core proof of Proposition 55 of [Frege1879] p. 50. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege55b
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ frege57b . Proposition 55 of [Frege1879] p. 50. Note that ~ eqtr2 incorporates ~ eqcom which is stronger than this proposition which is identical to ~ equcomi . Is it possible that Frege tricked himself into assuming what he was out to prove? (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege56b
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ frege57b . Proposition 56 of [Frege1879] p. 50. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege57b
blocks.content: Analogue of ~ frege57aid . Proposition 57 of [Frege1879] p. 51. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axfrege58b
blocks.content: If ` A. x ph ` is affirmed, ` [ y / x ] ph ` cannot be denied. Identical to ~ stdpc4 . Justification for ~ ax-frege58b . (Contributed by RP, 28-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: ax-frege58b
blocks.content: If ` A. x ph ` is affirmed, ` [ y / x ] ph ` cannot be denied. Identical to ~ stdpc4 . Axiom 58 of [Frege1879] p. 51. (Contributed by RP, 28-Mar-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege58bid
blocks.content: If ` A. x ph ` is affirmed, ` ph ` cannot be denied. Identical to ~ sp . See ~ ax-frege58b and ~ frege58c for versions which more closely track the original. Axiom 58 of [Frege1879] p. 51. (Contributed by RP, 28-Mar-2020.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege58bcor
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ frege59b . (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege59b
blocks.content: A kind of Aristotelian inference. Namely Felapton or Fesapo. Proposition 59 of [Frege1879] p. 51. _Note_: in the Bauer-Meenfelberg translation published in van Heijenoort's collection _From Frege to Goedel_, this proof has the ~ frege12 incorrectly referenced where ~ frege30 is in the original. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege60b
blocks.content: Swap antecedents of ~ ax-frege58b . Proposition 60 of [Frege1879] p. 52. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege61b
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ frege65b . Proposition 61 of [Frege1879] p. 52. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege62b
blocks.content: A kind of Aristotelian inference. This judgement replaces the mode of inference ~ barbara when the minor premise has a particular context. Proposition 62 of [Frege1879] p. 52. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege63b
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ frege91 . Proposition 63 of [Frege1879] p. 52. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege64b
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ frege65b . Proposition 64 of [Frege1879] p. 53. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege65b
blocks.content: A kind of Aristotelian inference. This judgement replaces the mode of inference ~ barbara when the minor premise has a general context. Proposition 65 of [Frege1879] p. 53. In Frege care is taken to point out that the variables in the first clauses are independent of each other and of the final term so another valid translation could be : ` |- ( A. x ( [ x / a ] ph -> [ x / b ] ps ) -> ( A. y ( [ y / b ] ps ` ` -> [ y / c ] ch ) -> ( [ z / a ] ph -> [ z / c ] ch ) ) ) ` . But that is perhaps too pedantic a translation for this exploration. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege66b
blocks.content: Swap antecedents of ~ frege65b . Proposition 66 of [Frege1879] p. 54. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege67b
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ frege68b . Proposition 67 of [Frege1879] p. 54. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: frege68b
blocks.content: Combination of applying a definition and applying it to a specific instance. Proposition 68 of [Frege1879] p. 54. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
